title: Logos by shape
content:
Hi.

Do you know of any resources grouping logos by shape? I'm working on a symbol that might just be a bit to simple to not have been done before.

Edit: Removed the image.
author: Frode Bo Helland

comments.content:
I don't know of an online resource, but Michael Evamy's ["Logo"](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/www.amazon.de/Logo-Michael-Evamy/dp/185669528X/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books-intl-de&qid=1262778968&sr=8-1) is structured like that. It contains a chapter "Circles and Dots".

- H

[Hörzu](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/de.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%C3%B6rzu) (a German TV listings magazine) has three overlapping circles (RGB).  
F

Thanks Hanno, I'll stop by the bookstore and have a glance.

Florian: Thanks.

Most national trademark registries have a specialized online search function, and the trademark entries themselves each have a plain-language description. Search for "four circles" + "diamond" in the description field and see what comes up.

Kevin: I couldn't find any that would search anything but text. Link?

Hanno: They were sold out for that particular book, but I looked through 5 other similar books and couldn't find anything.

It reminds me of some japanese mon.\* Here's a couple of sites that let you search by keyword:  
 [http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/ "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/")  
 [http://www.seeklogo.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/www.seeklogo.com/ "http://www.seeklogo.com/")

\* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mon\_(crest)

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Talleres%20CEAD_6250.jpg)

I did this when I was a rookie at the university.

·Panda·
I've searched both sites, and neither turned up anything remotely similar. I'm still not sure if I'm in the clear though …

<cite>I’m still not sure if I’m in the clear though …</cite>

Somewhere in the world there surely would be a similar logo.  
But I think that, once you have checked the competitors (and the Scottish Arts Council ;-)\* you should be safe.

\*  
 [http://inko9nito.wordpress.com/2007/10/16/quark-vs-scottish-arts-council/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/inko9nito.wordpress.com/2007/10/16/quark-vs-scottish-arts-council/ "http://inko9nito.wordpress.com/2007/10/16/quark-vs-scottish-arts-council/")  
 [http://www.momathome.com/2005/09/quark\_oopsie/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017065938/http:/www.momathome.com/2005/09/quark_oopsie/ "http://www.momathome.com/2005/09/quark\_oopsie/")
